shortdesc.ph: Whether to mute the recording signal.
Whether to mute the recording signal.
Mutes or unmutes the recording signal.

section.p:
If you have already called to adjust the volume of the audio capture signal, then calling this method and setting it to causes the SDK to:
Record the adjusted volume.
Mute the audio capture signal. When you call this method again and set it to , the recording signal is restored to the volume recorded by the SDK before muting.

If you have already called to adjust the volume of the audio capture signal, then calling this method with will cause the SDK to:
Record the adjusted volume.
Mute the audio capture signal. When you call this method again with , the recording signal will be restored to the volume recorded by the SDK before muting.

If you have already called to adjust the volume of the recorded audio signal, calling this method and setting it to will cause the SDK to:
Record the adjusted volume.
Mute the recording signal. When you call this method again with , the recording signal will be restored to the volume recorded by the SDK before muting.

If you have already called to adjust the recording signal volume, calling this method with will cause the SDK to:
Record the adjusted volume.
Mute the recording signal. When you call this method again with , the recording signal will be restored to the volume recorded by the SDK before muting.

section.title: Timing
section.p: Can be called before or after joining a channel.
Can be called before or after joining the channel.
Can be called before or after joining a channel.
Can be called before or after joining a channel.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
